p: We envision a future of MBF research with less reliance on NHP and rodent models and an increase in the number and rigor of in vitro and in silico studies. The emergence of new technologies (e.g., induced pluripotent stem cell models, organotypic cultures, and high throughput in silico screening) will help to better predict human pathogenesis and drug efficacy. We believe that harmonization of methods and centralization of data, together with combining different approaches to reach a common objective, are crucial to better understand MBF infection and neuropathogenesis and obtain clinical solutions.
